dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/413191305 at Thu Jan 23 17:50:46 UTC 2020

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr: avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) or avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="monitoring"})
2 * (avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) or avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="monitoring"})) - 1

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr: avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) or avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="monitoring"})
2 * (avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) or avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="monitoring"}))

panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"} +
2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}

avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"},
    0
  )
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO

targets.expr: avg(avg_over_time(slo_observation_status{slo="apdex_ratio", environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}[7d]))

panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO

targets.expr: avg_over_time(slo_observation_status{slo="error_ratio", environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}[7d])

panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr: avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) or avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="monitoring"})
2 * (avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) or avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="monitoring"}))

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service

targets.expr: avg(instance:node_cpu_utilization:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}) by (fqdn)

panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(max(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage", mode="idle"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)
,1),0)

panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service

targets.expr: sum(rate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)
sum(rate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}
,1),0)

panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)
avg(slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="cpu"}) by (component)
avg(slo:max:hard:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="cpu"}) by (component)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr: avg(slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="disk_space"}) by (component)
avg(slo:max:hard:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="disk_space"}) by (component)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}

  ,1)
,0)
avg(slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="memory"}) by (component)
avg(slo:max:hard:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="memory"}) by (component)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr: avg(slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="open_fds"}) by (component)
avg(slo:max:hard:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="open_fds"}) by (component)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", type="monitoring", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)
avg(slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="single_node_cpu"}) by (component)
avg(slo:max:hard:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="single_node_cpu"}) by (component)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr: avg(slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="go_memory"}) by (component)
avg(slo:max:hard:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{component="go_memory"}) by (component)

panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Saturation per Node

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="monitoring",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend
